content: The **Registry of Marriages** (**ROM**) is a government agency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) that administers all [marriages](/wiki/Marriages) carried out in the country and solemnises [civil marriages](/wiki/Marriage#State_recognition). ## Overview Marriage records in Singapore date back to the year 1875. On 15 September 1961, Civil Marriages came into force under the legislation. The Registry was established at the same time. ROM was originally located in [Fort Canning Park](/wiki/Fort_Canning_Park), opposite Park Mall Shopping Centre, but moved in 1983 to its current premises at Canning Rise. The Registry will be temporarily relocated to Esplanade Mall until 2028 while the premises at Canning Rise undergoes renovations. The Registry of Marriages keeps a record of all couples married in Singapore and issues the official [marriage certificate](/wiki/Marriage_certificate) after [solemnisation](/wiki/Wedding). Part of the mission of ROM is to administer the [Women Charter Act](/wiki/Women%27s_Charter_(Singapore)) in civil marriages. ROM is an agency of the [Ministry of Social and Family Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_Social_and_Family_Development_(Singapore)). - Official website This Singaporean organisation article is a stub.
